Class ModifiedBlink

  • java.lang.Object
    • ModifiedBlink
  • public class ModifiedBlink
extends java.lang.Object
    This program prompts the user to input the cards to match, player one's cards, and player two's cards, and then outputs the result of the hand. Each card is entered as a 5 character string. The cards to match are entered on one line. E.g., if 1YEMO 3BLST is entered, the cards to match are One Yellow Moon and Three Blue Stars. Player one's cards are enterend on one line, as are player two's cards. After the input is read, each player's hand is printed followed by the result of the match.
    Version:
    03/28/2021
    Author:
    Nour M. and Lulama N.

      • printPlayersCardsMatches

        public static void printPlayersCardsMatches​(int playerNumber,
                                            java.lang.String playersCards,
                                            java.lang.String cardsToMatch)
        This function prints the player's hand, the cards on the table, and how the player's cards match the cards on the table. E.g., if the input cards to match are 1YEMO 3BLST and the input player one's hand is 3REMO 2YELB 1BLMO, then this function would print Player One's Hand: Three Red Moons matches One Yellow Moon on Shape Three Red Moons matches Three Blue Stars on Number Two Yellow Lightning Bolts matches One Yellow Moon on Color Two Yellow Lightning Bolts does not match Three Blue Stars One Blue Moon matches One Yellow Moon on Number, Shape One Blue Moon matches Three Blue Stars on Color
        Parameters:
        playerNumber -
        playersCards -
        cardsToMatch -

      • getMatchDescription

        public static java.lang.String getMatchDescription​(java.lang.String firstCard,
                                                   java.lang.String secondCard)
        This function returns a string describing how the first card matches the second card. E.g., Three Red Moons matches One Yellow Moon on Shape If the cards do not match, an appropriate string is returned. E.g., Two Yellow Lightning Bolts does not match Three Blue Stars
        Parameters:
        firstCard - The first card to match.
        secondCard - The second card to match.
        Returns:
        A string describing how the strings match

      • printHandResults

        public static void printHandResults​(java.lang.String player1,
                                    java.lang.String player2,
                                    java.lang.String cardToMatch)
        This function prints the results of a single hand. A hand is first won on cards. If a single card of one player matches both of the cards on the table, that card is counted only as one match. The player with the most matching cards wins. If there is a tie on cards, then a hand is won on points. One point is awarded for each way a player's card matches either or both cards on the table. If there is still a tie, then the hand ends in a tie.
        Parameters:
        card1 - String The first player's hand.
        card2 - String The second player's hand.
        cardsToMatch - String The cards that each player is trying to match.

      • isMatch

        public static boolean isMatch​(java.lang.String card1,
                              java.lang.String card2)
        This function returns true if the input cards match in at least one way (number, color, or shape), and false otherwise. E.g., if the first card is 3REMO and the second card is 3BLSU, this function returns true because both cards have the number 3.
        Parameters:
        card1 - String The first card.
        card2 - String The second card.
        Returns:
        True if the cards match false otherwise.

      • getIndividualPoints

        public static int getIndividualPoints​(java.lang.String card1,
                                      java.lang.String card2)
        This function determines the number of ways the cards match. Each way they match is one point. Cards can match on number, color, or shape. E.g., if the first card is 3REMO and the second card is 3BLSU, this function would return 1 because the cards only match on number.
        Parameters:
        card1 - The first card.
        card2 - The second card.
        Returns:
        The number of ways the cards match.

      • getMatches

        public static java.lang.String getMatches​(java.lang.String card1,
                                          java.lang.String card2)
        This function returns a desription of how the two input cards match. Commas seperates matches. If the cards do not match, the empty string is returned.
        Parameters:
        card1 - The first card. E.g., 3REMO
        card2 - The second card. E.g., 3BLMO
        Returns:
        A description of how the two input cards match. E.g., for this example, Number, Shape

      • getCardName

        public static java.lang.String getCardName​(java.lang.String shortname)
        This function returns the name of the card in long form. E.g., if the input card is 3REMO, this function would return Three Red Moons. If the input card is 1BLSU, this function would return One Blue Sun.
        Parameters:
        shortName - The short name of the card.
        Returns:
        The long form name of the card using the correct plural noun.

      • getNumberName

        public static java.lang.String getNumberName​(int num)
        This function returns the name of the input number for numbers in [1, 5]. E.g., if 1 is input, One is returned.
        Parameters:
        num - An integer in [1,5].
        Returns:
        The name of the number

      • getColorName

        public static java.lang.String getColorName​(java.lang.String color)
        This function returns the name of the input color. Colors include Yellow (YE), Red (RE), Green (GR),Blue (BL), Brown (BR), and Grey (GY). E.g., if BR is input, Brown is output.
        Parameters:
        color - The short form of the color.
        Returns:
        The name of the color/

      • getShapeName

        public static java.lang.String getShapeName​(java.lang.String shape)
        This function returns the name of the input shape. Shapes include Moon (MO), Sun (SU), Star (ST), Snowflake (SN), Lightning Bolt (LB), and Raindrop (RA). E.g., if MO is input, Moon is output.
        Parameters:
        shape - The Short form of the shape.
        Returns:
        The name of the shape.
